PvP Generals (Free to Play)

Ranged General

Elektra and Tomyris can be obtained from relics while Minamoto can be obtained from the tavern. Tomyris has a higher fragment drop rate than Elektra.

General Attack Defense HP March size Rally Capacity Debuff
Minamoto 348.6 268.6 292.6 12 0 -
Elektra 365 294.8 263.2 28 0 -
Tomyris 352.4 277 329.2 26 10 -

Mounted Generals

Hannibal is avaible in the tavern. Roland, Custer and Li Namoasa are available in the relics.

General Attack Defense HP March size Rally Capacity Debuff
Hannibal 373.8 273.2 332.4 12 8 -
Roland 356.4 319 296.8 28 0 -20% ranged atk
George A. Custer 369.2 287.6 308.4 22 8 -
Li Naomasa 312.6 261.2 388.6 26 0 -10% all HP

Ground Generals

Elise and Scipio can be redeemed during the trial of knight event. It is recommend to ascend generals only during this event. Maeda and Soult are available in the relics and Robert the Bruce is available in the tavern.

General Attack Defense HP March size Rally Capacity Debuff
Elise 369.6 319.6 346 26 0 -
Scipio Africanus 329.2 339.8 333.4 18 8 -
Maeda Toshiie 365.4 300.4 320 18 8 -
Soult 338.6 300.8 318.8 12 8 -
Robert de Bruce 308 261 301.8 26 0 -

Siege Generals

Ulysse is avaible at the tavern and in the tavern chest.

General Attack Defense HP March size Rally Capacity Debuff
Ulysse S. Grant 335.6 271.6 258.4 32 0 -

PvP gear

When gearing your generals with red equipment, it's best to have at least from the dragon/ares/imperal set of the same level and of the Achaemenidae/Parthian set (same levle again) to unlock the first set bonus of increase attack. The last items can be of either set.

Ranged (red combination)

Rnaged 

        Ares Bow
        Fearless Ares Helmet
        Majestic Imperial Armor (Courageous Dragon Armor) for ranged and siege attack debuff or Dominant Imperial Armor for Ranged troop HP
        Courageous Achaemenidae Leg Armor 
        Fearless Achaemenidae Boots
        Fearless Achaemenidae Ring

Subordinate city generals

There are 2 types of sub generals: peacetime and PvP. Peacetime sub generals should focus on the contruction of your subs. The higher level they are the stronger the troops are and the more gold they produce. PvP sub generals focus on debuffs. They can be used both for attacking and defending the main city but not both simultaneously.

Peacetime generals

Empress Wu and Jefferson both focus on construction speed. By cultivating their leadership and their politics to increase gold production, training speed and construction speed. For skill books, gold production, training capacity and training speed can added. If you want to train troops, Charles Martel is very good as he also has some increasing construction speed. All of these generals are available in the tavern. Sub cities can be gold oriented, balances of troop training oriented.

PvP generals

The biggest part of the debuff is coming from the gear. All of the sub generals should be fully equiped with Achaemenidae or its upgrade. The debuff should primaly focus on attack for ranged and siege and on HP for ground and mounted. Any unused spiritual animals can be equipped on sub generals as they have debuffs. The following generals are good generals available in the tarvern: Andrew Jackson, Harald, Arminius, Nero and Marguerite. If you generals always died during attacks, the re

Gathering generals

A good gathering set up can get you over 1B of resources per day if you have 6 marches and 6 Jindeok and a good amount of Korean subs. The best set up is done by having specialized gatherers for one specific resource.

The main gathering general should be Jindeok and if you don't have enough of her, Constance should be used. Politics and level should be max out and leadership should be as high as possible to increase the speed march. March speed and troop loading skill books should be used on Jindeok to avoid any conflict with the assitants (mostly Gaius).

All assistant should have a gathering speed book and an exploitation book (if you have them) for the specific resource they are specialized for. Gaius should be used for ore. Lucy and Gaius can be used for stone and lumber. Shimazo should be used for food.

Ore gathering
Main: Jindeok or Constance (march speed and troop load skill books)
Assistant : Gaius (ore exploitation and ore gathering speed books) 

        King's bow with ore gathering speed refinement
        Champion's armor (optional, march speed refinement)
        Fearless King's boots
        Courageous King's helmet with ore gathering speed refinement
        Champion's leg armor with ore gathering speed refinement

Lumber gathering
Main: Jindeok or Constance (march speed and troop load skill books)
Assistant : Gaius or Lucy (lumber exploitation and lumber gathering speed books) 

        King's axe with lumber gathering speed refinement
        Fearless King's armor
        Champion's boots (optional, march speed refinement)
        Champion's Helmet with lumber gathering speed refinement
        Courageous King's Leg armor with lumber gathering speed refinement

Ore gathering
Main: Jindeok or Constance (march speed and troop load skill books)
Assistant : Gaius (ore exploitation and ore gathering speed books) 

        King's bow with ore gathering speed refinement
        Champion's armor
        Fearless King's boots (optional, march speed refinement)
        Courageous King's helmet with ore gathering speed refinement
        Champion's leg armor with ore gathering speed refinement

Food gathering
Main: Jindeok or Constance (march speed and troop load skill books)
Assistant : Gaius (ore exploitation and ore gathering speed books) 

        King's spear with food gathering speed refinement
        Courageous King's armor
        Champion's boots (optional, march speed refinement)
        Fearless King's helmet with food gathering speed refinement
        Champion's leg armor with food gathering speed refinement

HTML Style

Every browser has a specific engine that parses the HTML document and displays a default style of the page content. 

<body style="background-color:yellow;">

                <h1>TechGeekBuzz</h1>
                <p>Welcome to TechGeekBuzz.</p>
                
                </body>

HTML Formatting

In HTML, we have many special elements that can provide special meaning to text content.

HTML Elements Description
<b> Bold the text
<strong> An alternative for <b>, which tell that this text is essential.
<i> Italic the text
<em> Similar to italic but used when we want to emphasize the text.
<mark> It marks the text with a default "yellow" background colour
<small> Decrease the text size
<del> It prints a cross line over the text.
<ins> Represents the inserted text by putting an underline.
<sub> This element is used to display the subscript.
<sup> It can make a text superscript.

Reference

  • All the documentation in this page is taken from HTML Tutorial
